scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials relating to Edward R. Squibb, his family, and his company, Squibb Pharmaceuticals. Items include correspondence, a family bible, books, pamphlets, additional printed materials, and nine antique pharmaceutical containers.
Letter from Catharine Harrison Squibb to her son Edward R. Squibb (with typed transcript), 1832
Map of the property of J.I. and S. Joseph and Company, in Brooklyn's Fifth Ward, 1836 (Gold Street, between Plymouth Street and Marshall Street, along the East River)
2 New York State Medical Society reports, 1861
1 medical paper by the Squibb brothers, 1884
Journal of Edward Robison Squibb M.D., 1819-1900, bound in two volumes, 1930
7 Squibb pharmaceutical products and containers, circa 1880-1920
A more detailed inventory is available in the collection's accession file.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Edward Robinson Squibb (1819-1900) was a physician and chemist. He was born in Wilmington, DE and attended Jefferson Medical College in Philadelphia, PA. Shortly after graduating, he was appointed a surgeon in the United States Navy. He then ran a medical station at the Brooklyn Navy Yard in Brooklyn, N.Y. before opening his own pharmaceutical company, Squibb Pharmaceuticals, in Brooklyn. The company later became E.R. Squibb & Sons, and eventually became part of the major pharmaeutical company Bristol-Myers Squibb.
